news.title: Chris Mason: Reeves chooses to tax big and spend big
news.summary: In a Budget dogged by months of leaks, Labour hopes its big tax and spend plans pay off.

news.title: Nine ways the Budget could affect you if you're under 25
news.summary: The chancellor's Budget contained a slew of measures which will impact young people specifically.

news.title: 'This is no life': Security and long-held views shattered in south Lebanon amid Israeli strikes
news.summary: A year on from a ceasefire in Lebanon, Israel is continuing attacks on what it says are Hezbollah's efforts to recover from their war.

news.title: US suspends immigration requests for Afghans after National Guard shooting
news.summary: The alleged gunman in the Washington shooting is an Afghan national who entered the US in September 2021.

news.title: Paul Doyle's neighbours were left stunned after he drove car into Liverpool parade
news.summary: Paul Doyle was considered a steady, dependable family man before a 'calculated' act of violence.

news.title: Woman killed in shark attack in Australia
news.summary: The woman died at the scene and a man was critically injured after the attack in New South Wales.

news.title: 'I earn £20k and live with my son. The Budget means we will pay more tax'
news.summary: BBC News hears from people with a range of incomes about what they think of the Budget.

news.title: The Papers: 'High welfare, high tax' and 'Budget goes as billed'
news.summary: Budget highlights, lowlights, and an OBR blunder lead all the front pages in Thursday's papers.

news.title: 'Our £3.6m bill for flats too dangerous to live in'
news.summary: Two unsafe tower blocks in Kirkby, Merseyside, were closed down by the fire service in July.

news.title: Georgia's pro-EU protesters defiant year after accession process was halted
news.summary: The demonstrations began when Georgia's prime minister called a four-year halt on moves towards joining the EU.
